page.title: 09 TREVOR MACDONALD
page.content: Journalist, newscaster and author, Trevor lives in Sheen because he finds it a pleasant, friendly place, convenient for work. He is currently publicising his new book about West Indies cricketer Clive Lloyd. Trevor Macdonald was born and educated in Trinidad. He read Politics at university. He first got involved in broadcasting while at school, where he ran a radio show on the intercom. He is surprised that his becoming the first black newsreader in the UK should have created so much interest. He is ambivalent about his work. TV newsreading is a team effort, offering little personal reward. It is glamorous but lightweight, unlike reporting on the international political scene, which he views as a way of bringing about greater understanding between people.
